author: jennifer
title: YOGA+ on PRISM
description: Yoga has always been too offline and out of balance. A pre-covid billion dollar industry was already wrought with a myriad of dysfunction.

assessments.note: Yoga teaching and prescriptions are not standardized even in India leading to a large number of self-claimed Yogies.  There is an urgent need for a decentralized and verifiable certification in the emerging field. The solution proposed is ideal to solve this specific issue.
It is an interesting proposal which would bring new users into the Cardano ecosystem
assessments.reply: We provide details in the attachements that highlight the uniique use case

assessments.note:
In my opinion this proposal is within the challenge goal. At the same time I think is more related about relaunching an online Yoga class and related services: it's not sure that this kind of activities help many connection with the Cardano ecosystem.
Furthermore the relation with Cardano blockchain services it is not deep specified, so I suggest to better introduce and explain HOW Cardano services were used, through use cases related to user's operations (e.g how ATALA prism functionalities were implemented to develop Yoga marketplace…). However the objective of the proposal not only related to Cardano but versus other online services (es. e-commerce, chat, …).
assessments.reply: We provide details in the attachements that highlight the uniique use case

assessments.note: In addition to using transaction metadata to store certificates and contracts, the proposal provides the novel use case of recording yoga sequences/prescriptions there. It also incorporates innovate use of Wolfram Language Entities. However, it is not clear whether Atala PRISM will be publicly available during the Q3-Q4 timeframe of this project, so that might put the identity-related aspects of the project at risk.

The project checklist presents a clear feasible plan for execution. The goal is well-defined and major technical risk is not expected since the use case is apparently a straight forward use of Metadata.
Proposers have both domain and technical experience.

The proposal team is completed skilled on Yoga platforms and related app world, but it's not well and clear documented  other fundamental experiences on blockchain, so it's difficult to have have a good trade-off  between business and technical knowledge. In relation to the possible success of the initiative, it's difficult to define because there aren't business case in the documentation that introduce rationales… I think that the proposer have to better describe that.  Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the issue related to the market or adoption risks.
assessments.reply: team has been in the blockchain space as detailed in referenced links, includiing related project with Wolfram in 2019

assessments.note: The attachments to the proposal outline a sufficiently detailed plan, but it appears that the team will rely significantly on consulting with IOHK to mitigate execution risks. Also, it may not be realistic to put use of Atala PRISM on the critical path to success, given that PRISM's public release date has not been announced.

The project proposal and checklist are detailed. The developer support will be available after the smart contract feature is rolled out. The proposers aim to recruit pioneers to write the smart contract. No inherent developer capability is claimed. I feel this will not hinder the project.
More information should be provided on the goals. Why is the blockchain required to manage metadata of distributed creations. Is goal 3 planning to use ADA for payments or rewards in their system?
assessments.reply: we are the experts in this yoga+tech+blockchain space, the attached details and references are ample in comparison to other projects

assessments.note: The proposer provides a briefly plan for the implementation with milestones and a defined time horizon, but I think the proposer is missing some information about adoption and delivery of the solution, also the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them.. The proposer hasn't considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.
assessments.reply: it does not seem like the proposal was read, if so it would be clear that there is both a plan and a competent team to deliver

assessments.note: The proposal does not outline a staged development process, so it would be difficult to gauge progress towards the final goal. The final goals, however, are defined in the proposal, though they could have been specified in concrete technical detail, rather than briefly and abstractly.
assessments.reply: the challenge goals were addressed completely in the provided proposal details; additional work-product would be beyond the average proposal for this challenge

solution: A market network empowering the yogi ecosystem, built using the best available platforms and tools.
experience: Experienced Founders with Yoga Industry domain knowledge paired with CTO with hands on experience needed to succeed.
